What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback

Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: Readings took between 5-10 hours a week. Assignments took roughly the same time except the final paper, which probably took around 20-30 hours from researching to completion.

This course was by far the best course I have taken at Yale in the three semesters that I have been here. My thinking on issues covered in this course have gone through a complete evolution since the first class in August and I feel that I am able to better articulate myself, both verbally and in writing, on issues of sexuality, gender, health and human rights as a result of this course.

Fantastic course. Easily one of the best offered to YSPH students. Highly recommend anyone looking to learn more about the role of law and history on how we define sexuality and gender within health and, more generally, within cultures, to take this course.

the size of the course was a big strength because it fostered deeper discussion. 
it might be improved with even more small group discussion, though I think it depends on the group each year what they will engage with.

Professor Miller fostered an environment that facilitated open discussion and intellectual stimulation. I greatly appreciated her thoughtful feedback on assignments as well as her willingness to meet in-person outside of scheduled class time.

Ali is a dream to learn from. One of the best professors at YSPH. You'll learn so much from her. She keeps discussion on track, raises critically important questions, guiding the conversation around important themes, and keeps students on point with how language can shape our understanding of sexuality, gender and health within human rights.
amazing, caring, and considerate--really loved the class with Ali!
I would highly recommend this course to fellow students.
Highly recommend this course. One of the best I've taken at YSPH. I've learned so much from this course that will impact how I think about health and health care.
I would definitely recommend it to people interested in the topic.  It is a difficult course if you haven't taken one like it before, but it is of course worth it.

highly recommend to all fellow students! a must-take class. I have explore these topics so much more because of the class, and hope to continue my studies of the topics we discussed over the course of the semester.
